title: transaction creating contract is mined, but getCode returns 0x

body: This issue appears to be a regression (I reran steps on commit b0a5be4 and getCode was correct).

Actually i think what happens is that you contract consumes to much gas, and therefore is never mined.
Maybe you even provide enough gas for the contract execution, but not enough for the contract storing.

Additionally the contract gas requirement could have been to much for the block.
His contract gas is probably fine, having the same issue with small contracts. The last working commit is 9d8b512 and the regression was introduced in 654564e
nonce is also increased by 1 from the start for no apparent reason
Tagging as show stopper until we get this issue sorted since this potentially affects core code
Not a show stopper. Non-core. It appears that the logged output (e.g. `created: bd770416a3345f91e4b34576cb804a576fa48eb1`) is inaccurate. Will fix later

```
                                                                                  Expanding on that, the log message is wrong because it derives the addressÂ from the unsigned tx in xeth.go (my fault).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           â€Ž
```
https://github.com/ethereum/go-ethereum/pull/1378 fixes that by not using the transaction but directly the supplied `addr` instead and using `crypto.CreateAddress`.
